data.event: Copper mining in the area began late in the Spanish colonial period, but it was not until 1803 that Franscisco Manuel Elguea, a Chihuahua banker and businessman, founded the town of Santa Rita.

data.event: In 1837, however, an American trader named John Johnson lured the Apaches to a gathering and then massacred them to sell their scalps for the bounty offer by the Mexican government.
The town was abandoned until 1849, when the U.S.Army established a command post on the site, calling it Cantonment Dawson.
